definition: to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]

sentences.english: The PIV technique and auxiliary dye-tracer technique are used to display the flow field.
sentences.chinese: 流场显示以PIV技术为主，辅以染料示踪技术。

sentences.english: The patient was treated with surgery and adjuvant radiotherapy followed by systemic chemotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 于肿瘤摘除术后辅以放射治疗及化学治疗。

sentences.english: The treatment of waste washed wool water with polymeric iron sulfate and activated clay as flocculating agent was studied in this article.
sentences.chinese: 以聚合硫酸铁辅以活性白土为絮凝剂处理洗羊毛污水。

sentences.english: Conclusions: Brace treatment with supplementary physical therapy is the treatment of choice for patients with compression fractures of the thoracic and lumbar spine.
sentences.chinese: 支具并辅以理疗是胸腰椎压缩性骨折的一种治疗策略。

sentences.english: Fiscal policy strategies need to be complemented by growth-enhancing structural reforms.
sentences.chinese: 财政政策战略需要辅以促进增长的结构性改革措施。

sentences.english: At the same time of teaching English, we should also teach the related knowledge of cross- culture communication.
sentences.chinese: 在英语教学的同时应辅以跨文化交际相关知识的传授。

sentences.english: The heat sinker adopts refined aluminum-alloy with anodixe process on the surface pure color.
sentences.chinese: 散热体采用铝合金，表面辅以阳处理。

sentences.english: The main therapy was operation, companied by chemotherapy.
sentences.chinese: 治疗以手术为主，辅以化疗。

sentences.english: English lessons are broadcast every day on the radion with explanations in English and other languages.
sentences.chinese: 英语课每天广播，并辅以英语和其他语言解说。

sentences.english: This machine has a track, the block can be transported to truck or ship directly.
sentences.chinese: 机器前端出包，辅以道轨，能直接上车上船。

sentences.english: Choose low-fat, calcium-rich foods and deep green vegetables as an alternate source.
sentences.chinese: 辅以低脂肪，高钙质的食物和深绿色蔬菜。

sentences.english: The hotel is built round a courtyard, with fountain and palm tree.
sentences.chinese: 这家饭店围绕一庭院而建，辅以泉水和棕榈树。

definition: in addition/moreover/(used before a disyllabic verb to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
to rely mainly on/to attach most importance to
to choose for some purpose/to select and use
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
